links.title: Caldwell Cassady & Curry Helps VirnetX Win $502.6 Million Verdict Against Apple
links.description: Dallas law firm wins another patent infringement trial for VirnetX TYLER, Texas, April 11, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- The Dallas-based intellectual property and business litigation law firm Caldwell Cassady & Curry has won a unanimous $502.6 million patent infringement verdict for Nevada-based VirnetX Inc. (NYSEAMERICAN: VHC) against Apple Inc.

links.title: Variety: Apple Music has 40M subscribers, gets new worldwide head
links.description: Variety reports that Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) has promoted Oliver Schusser to become head of Apple Music Worldwide. Schusser has worked on overseas promotions of the App Store, iTunes' movies and TV, iBooks, and more and played a key role in the Shazam acquisition.

links.title: Apple Music Passes 40 Million Subscribers, Spooking Spotify Investors
links.description: Apple's ( AAPL) subscription music service Apple Music has passed 40 million paying subscribers, according to a news report, which sent shares of recent IPO Spotify Technology ( SPOT) tumbling on Wednesday. The company disclosed the news in an internal memo announcing new leadership for the business, according to Variety.

links.title: AAPL still stuck within tight trading range
links.description: Highlights Overview AAPL ended Wednesday at 172.44 losing $0.81 (-0.47%) on low volume. Closing within the prior day's range, prices failed to decisively move past the previous day's trading range in a lackluster session. Ending the day with an indecisive close, neither buyers nor sellers were able to gain control during the session.
